hypothesis_content.title: Momentum Divergence at Regime Extremes
hypothesis_content.statement: In a strong BULL regime (confidence > 75%), if BTC's 14-day RSI makes a lower high while price makes a higher high over a 10-day period, and the Crypto Fear & Greed Index is > 80, it signals an impending transition to NEUTRAL or BEAR within the next 15 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Classic momentum divergence at sentiment extremes often precedes trend exhaustion. In crypto, extreme greed combined with weakening momentum (RSI divergence) while the regime is strongly bullish suggests the trend is overextended and vulnerable to a correction or consolidation.
entry_conditions: Primary regime model shows BULL with confidence > 75%
BTC price makes a 10-day higher high
BTC 14-day RSI makes a concurrent lower high (bearish divergence)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime model shifts to NEUTRAL or BEAR (signal validated)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price increases >8% from divergence point without a regime shift, invalidating the divergence signal
exit_conditions.time_exit: 15 trading days post-divergence if no regime transition occurs

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Fewer than 40% of such divergence signals at regime extremes are followed by a regime transition within the specified window, indicating the bull trend can sustain divergence longer than expected.
